availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Anson N. Hoskins (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, attorney and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary Hoskins. Father of Elizabeth Hoskins and Henry Hoskins. Attorney in Philadelphia in 1850. Delegate to the Republic Party Convention in 1862. Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Pennsylvania in 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, Philadelphia, Upper Delaware Ward, p. 24; "Republican Convention," The Philadelphia Inquirer (Philadelphia, Pa.), January 17, 1862, p. 8; "Deaths," The Philadelphia Inquirer, August 26, 1867, p. 5; KYR-0001-007-0346.
